encodingDesc.p: To encode the Dracula Film, I will be selecting and marking up segments of 1931 film transcript. In this marking up, I will make use of the <sound>, <view>, and <camera> tags to describe details that would not be obvious in the film's transcript alone.
In addition to the film's transcript, I will link to images/frames from the film in which a description would not easily suffice.

All segments I include, whether they be textual or visual, will link to a relevant theme in themes.xml. Along with each link, there will be a footnote (in an interpretation tag) with my analysis and why I included the segment in my mark up.

seg.p: DRACULA: Van Helsing! Now that you have learned what you have learned, it would be well for you to return to your own country.
HELSING: I prefer to remain and protect those whom you would destroy.
DRACULA: You are too late. My blood now flows through her veins. She will live through the centuries to come...as I have lived.
HELSING: Should you escape us, Dracula, we know how to save Miss Mina's soul if not her life.
DRACULA: If she dies by day. But I shall see that she dies by night.
HELSING: And I will have Carfax Abbey torn down stone by stone, excavated a mile around. I will find your earth box and drive that stake through your heart.
DRACULA: The camera holds on Dracula with his arm lifted beckoning Van Helsing Come here. Cut to similar angle of Van Helsing Long silence between the cuts to and from Dracula Come...here.
HELSING: (Takes three steps toward Dracula, then backs up)
DRACULA: Your will is strong, Van Helsing.
Dracula approahces Van Helsing Van Helsing reaches into his pocket
HELSING: More effective than wolfbane, Count.
